A: 1. If I have 3 pencils and my friend gives me 2 more, how many pencils do I have now? (a) 3 (b) 5 (c) 2
2. There are 5 birds in a tree. 4 more birds come. How many birds are in the tree now? (a) 5 (b) 9 (c) 3
3. I have 4 toys. My mom buys me 1 more toy. How many toys do I have now? (a) 3 (b) 4 (c) 5
4. If I have 8 crayons and I give 2 to my sister, how many crayons do I have left? (a) 6 (b) 8 (c) 10
5. There are 9 balls in a basket. 3 balls are taken out. How many balls are left in the basket? (a) 6 (b) 9 (c) 12
6. I have 7 books. I give 1 book to my friend. How many books do I have now? (a) 6 (b) 7 (c) 8
7. If I have 2 groups of 3 pencils, how many pencils do I have in total? (a) 2 (b) 3 (c) 6
8. If there are 5 dogs in a park and 2 more dogs come, how many dogs are in the park now? (a) 5 (b) 7 (c) 3
9. I have 9 stickers. I give 4 stickers to my brother. How many stickers do I have left? (a) 5 (b) 9 (c) 13
10. If I have 1 pencil and I get 4 more pencils, how many pencils do I have now? (a) 1 (b) 4 (c) 5
11. There are 8 children in a playground. 2 children go home. How many children are left in the playground? (a) 6 (b) 8 (c) 10
12. If I have 6 marbles and I lose 1 marble, how many marbles do I have left? (a) 5 (b) 6 (c) 7
13. If I have 3 balls and my friend gives me 2 more balls, how many balls do I have now? (a) 3 (b) 5 (c) 2
14. If there are 9 pencils in a box and 3 pencils are taken out, how many pencils are left in the box? (a) 6 (b) 9 (c) 12
15. I have 5 naira. My mom gives me 2 naira. How much money do I have now? (a) 5 naira (b) 7 naira (c) 3 naira
